etymology.description: Ideogrammic compound: 囗 ‘enclosure; city wall’ + 卪 ‘kneeling person’; bottom part unrelated to 巴 and top most likely unrelated to original 丁.
etymology.interpretation: Combines a walled enclosure with a person to depict a community where people live or gather within protective walls. By showing someone inside fortifications, it evokes the idea of a town or settlement organized around its walls and civic center.

examples.chinese: 古代诸侯在其邑中修筑城墙(古代諸侯在其邑中修築城牆)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài zhūhóu zài qí yì zhōng xiūzhù chéngqiáng.
examples.english: In ancient times, feudal lords built city walls within their settlements.

examples.chinese: 此邑临河(此邑臨河)，贸易兴盛(貿易興盛)。
examples.pinyin: Cǐ yì lín hé, màoyì xīngshèng.
examples.english: This town lies by a river, and trade flourishes.

examples.chinese: 史书记载此邑曾为郡治(史書記載此邑曾為郡治)。
examples.pinyin: Shǐshū jìzǎi cǐ yì céng wéi jùnzhì.
examples.english: Historical records note this settlement once served as a commandery seat.
